sen.j: 近衛 経熙（このえ つねひろ、宝暦11年2月22日 (旧暦)（1761年3月28日） - 寛政11年6月25日 (旧暦)（1799年7月27日））は江戸時代中期の公家。
sen.e: Tsunehiro KONOE (28th March, 1761 to July 27,1799) was a court noble in the middle Edo period.
Tsunehiro KONOE (28th March, 1761 to July 27,1799) was a court noble in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: middle Edo period→middle of the Edo period. としました。
sen.e: Tsunehiro KONOE (28th March, 1761 to July 27,1799) was a court noble in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 父は近衛内前、母は尾張藩主・徳川宗春の娘・勝子。
sen.e: His father was Uchisaki KONOE, and his mother Katsuko was a daughter of Muneharu TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari clan.
His father was Uchisaki KONOE, and his mother Katsuko was a daughter of Muneharu TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari clan.
His father was Uchisaki KONOE, and his mother Katsuko was a daughter of Muneharu TOKUGAWA, the Lord of Owari clan.

sen.j: 姉は後桃園天皇の女御・近衛維子。
sen.e: His elder sister was Koreko KONOE, nyogo of Emperor Gomomozono.
His elder sister was Koreko KONOE, nyogo of Emperor Gomomozono.
His elder sister was Koreko KONOE, nyogo of Emperor Gomomozono.

sen.j: 正室は有栖川宮職仁親王の娘（桜町天皇の猶子）・泰宮薫子女王（円台院）。
sen.e: His legal wife was the daughter (adopted child of Emperor Sakuramachi) Princess Yasunomiya Taruko (Endaiin) of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito.
His legal wife was Princess Yasunomiya Taruko (Endaiin), a daughter (adopted child of Emperor Sakuramachi) of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito.
His legal wife was Princess Yasunomiya Taruko (Endaiin), a daughter (adopted child of Emperor Sakuramachi) of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito.

sen.j: 子に近衛基前、大僧正法務 (仏教)亮深。
sen.e: Among his children were Motosaki KONOE, and Ryoshin (highest-ranking Buddhist, director of temple affairs).
Among his children were Motosaki KONOE, and daisojo (highest-ranking Buddhist, director of temple affairs), Ryoshin..
Among his children were Motosaki KONOE, and daisojo (highest-ranking Buddhist, director of temple affairs), Ryoshin..

sen.j: 養女に薩摩藩主・島津重豪の娘で徳川家斉の御台所・広大院（寔子）がいる。
sen.e: Among his adopted daughters was Kodaiin, who was a daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan) and a wife of Ienari TOKUGAWA.
Among his adopted daughters was Kodaiin (Tadako), who was a daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan) and a wife of Ienari TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/広大院 に「寔子=ただこ」とありました。
sen.e: Among his adopted daughters was Kodaiin (Tadako), who was a daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan) and a wife of Ienari TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 官位は従一位・右大臣。
sen.e: His official rank was Junior First Rank Minister of the Right.
His official rank was Junior First Rank Minister of the Right.
His official rank was Junior First Rank Minister of the Right.
